intro: Psychotria apodocephala, commonly known as the "white psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria apodocephala is also noted for its role in the ecological interactions of its native habitat, particularly as a host plant for certain insects.
